visualization_prompt: Generate a dotplot showing monthly inventory transactions using categorical comparison with dual-series encoding
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 2-dimensional categorical data comparing monthly transaction counts across two discrete series. Three monthly categories (Jan-Mar) are paired with integer counts for bought/sold items. Original user-provided data was preserved with range validation (0-5 transactions matches retail inventory patterns). The dotplot format maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines and axes decoration while maintaining precise positional encoding. Color saturation (green=growth, red=depletion) follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles. Proportional circle areas maintain Weber-Fechner law compliance for quantity perception. Exact numerical labels preserve metric precision while dot clusters enable instant pattern recognition.
